alert.note: Alert for Bath (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 18 at 3:37AM EDT until April 18 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed wintry precipitation expected. Snow accumulations up to 3 inches are possible along the crest of Warm Springs Mountain with a glaze of ice in the trees. * WHERE...Bath County. * WHEN...Today. * IMPACTS...Untreated roads and surfaces, especially at the higher elevations of the mountains, could become snow covered, slick, and hazardous. The hazardous conditions are expected to impact Highway 39, between Warm Springs and Millboro Springs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures are expected to remain near 30 degrees along the crest of Warm Springs Mountain through the day. Temperatures tonight are expected to drop into the 20s.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow...sleet...or freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for slippery roads and limited visibilities...and use caution while driving. Please report snow, sleet or ice accumulations via email at rnk.skywarn@noaa.gov or by calling the National Weather Service toll free at...1...866...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Leave a message with your observation and the specific location where it occurred. You can also post your report to National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
